content: BTW, something else I've been thinking about is that we need to produce a "Guide to using Zulip" and so forth, and document our Zulip conventions -- there are also a bunch of open questions on my mind (e.g., default streams, etc)
I raised this over in #zulip at some point -- and actually I have a bunch of unread messages there,.
I would raise this as a candidate for a "sprint task"
Somewhat related - when creating wg streams, I normally subscribe everyone who is subscribed to t-compiler - we should standardize that.
I think I would rather get to a place where people are actively cultivating their own streams, but maybe it remains best to say that you get "added by default" and you learn how to take yourself off
Also, Zulip has Zoom integration that might be worth trying.

BTW, something else I've been thinking about is that we need to produce a "Guide to using Zulip" and so forth, and document our Zulip conventions -- there are also a bunch of open questions on my mind (e.g., default streams, etc)

very good idea :)
